text: Terence Patrick Dicks (17 March 1937 – 17 June 2020) was a British Conservative Party politician. He was MP for the constituency of Hayes and Harlington from 1983 to his retirement in 1997. He first ran in Bristol South in 1979, but lost to Labour's Michael Cocks. Dicks called for the BBC soap opera EastEnders to be cancelled following a storyline involving a gay kiss between two men. Dicks was born with cerebral palsy and called himself in the House of Commons as a "spastic.""House of Commons Hansard", Column 544, 11 May 1994. From 1999 until he retired in June 2009 Dicks was a member of Surrey County Council representing the town of Addlestone. Dicks died on 17 June 2020 at the age of 83.Remembrance of departed colleagues ==References== Category:1937 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Conservative Party (UK) MPs Category:UK MPs 1983–1987 Category:UK MPs 1987–1992 Category:UK MPs 1992–1997
title: Terry Dicks
